title: iMac related_Used the scissor icon on my Toolbar to Capture. Unable to retrive and paste in a Finder Window
content:
Where is the screenshot saved on an iMac? I have a Firefox webpage and I used thr scissor over a paper icon Add-on that is in my Toolbar and it seems to work correctly as it opens the Add-on. I use the save whole page option. I am unable to locate the screenshot to place in a Finder window, I have checked all of the Screenshot folders and the Dropbox trying to locate the file with negative results. I tried both the Download and the Copy options but neither work.

It used to work ok when there was an icon to press next to the Add a Bookmark icon in the Title Bar. It appears to do the samething except place it somewhere I can find it.

Thanks in advance!
creator: andyhutch1947

title: Autoplay is blocked even when Firefox is set to allow audio and video autoplay settings
content:
YouTube videos do not autoplay - I have to manually press play every time a new video starts. This is highly tedious because I use the miniplayer very frequently, and I have to close the miniplayer (I suppose I could skip this step), reopen Firefox, press play, reopen the miniplayer, and then repeat the cycle when a new video plays. I tried this with Microsoft Edge (which I hate with a passion), and didn't have this happen, so I'm pretty sure this is something with Firefox. Every time I tried to look this up, i never found someone with this issue, so I'm pretty sure it's something I did, and I can't figure out how to undo it ahah.

If anyone knows what I can do to fix this, help is appreciated.

Respect
creator: tylerjohns7

title: bookmarks
content: New Firefox user here trying it out. When using bookmarks, is there an option to get rid of the stuff outlined in red? I want to see bookmarks only, not the other part. Too cluttered for me and screws up scrolling upon reaching the end of the list of saved bookmarks. Thx

title: Problem adding folders to toolbar and problem deleting folders
content:
I am having two major problems with bookmarks.

1. I can't add an existing folder to the bookmark toolbar. I can add a bookmark, but not a folder.

2. I have added a couple of empty folders and cannot delete them. I have clicked on "remove folder" in multiple locations and nothing happens.
creator: steve372

title: Can't get rid of what I believe is hopefully just a super cookie and not malware or a trojan?
content: I put items in a cart on a website that I accessed through firefox. I did not sign into any accounts on the website and I did not purchase the items. I then cleared my cookies, cache, and offline data. Later on I went back to the website and wanted to put items back in the cart to re-price everything and discovered that the items were still in the cart from before. I cleared cookies, etc. again and the items were still in the cart. I then went to the website on Chrome and the items were still in the cart. Again, I did not sign into any accounts or anything. I never use Chrome. Just went straight to the website on Chrome and went to the cart and the items were there even though I didn't use Chrome to put anything in the cart. I then cleared cookies, etc. on Chrome and the items were still in the cart. I tried this on Edge and same thing. I have used Bitdefender, Malwarebytes, Hitman Pro, and CC Cleaner and no program is finding the malware or spyware or trojan or whatever this is. This is a well-known website that even has a facebook page. I messaged the webmaster and I posted on their facebook page and I'm being ignored. What is this and how do I get rid of it?
creator: trueheiressofslytherin
